posts.body:
>>056d4cce-a364-4bc1-85a4-132e2edccdf7
Are you going to run a server 24/7? You know ZeroID does the throttling by running a central server 24/7, right?
If you couldn't even solve the problem with the file extensions I don't see you running a CA, sorry.

>>c70243c4-407a-44f8-abd2-448148d62f81
Modifying 08chan's code to achieve what?

>>d85b734d-c008-4c0b-b69c-98721dd1cfee
Nah, he IS retarded. He has been trying to add support for .zip files for months now. I even cloned the site (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HamXwKoauiykRmVLrQxDVjRGoVZX7ngkE/), made the necessary modifications and sent the link of the cloned site to him so he could copy the code to the actual site, and he's too useless to do even that.
Literally the only accomplishment he's ever had was cloning Millchan and then spamming his shitty outdated clone on /v/ (which isn't that outdated anymore only because other people hand held him through the update process).

>>08a457ae-308c-4e8c-8e26-deed2ce45023
Thanks for the link. The media blackout is indeed dumbfounding.
Also I doubt the stories of people going to help him. At most 1 or 2, otherwise we'd have way more pics and reports of the situation.
I wonder if he has a radio and has tried establishing contact with the outside world since his Internet has been cut.
We prepper types really should have radio nets where we check in regularly and verify we can communicate in a grid down situation.
Having a Baofeng in the drawer only for it to be useless once shit hits the fan just because they don't know what frequency to tune in is... well, shitty.

We should all just move over to Millchan. He's the guy who actually developed the software we're all posting on.
The retarded namefag who runs this site (Acid) just cloned it and spammed his shitty outdated version of it on /v/.

>>6838dfc0-9517-4a68-900b-eb586f5d1ced
I don't know what you're talking about

>>afde9a20-4532-4c4c-bf17-61553ac89dd2
It's literally the same as this site and nowadays even more active lol (although admittedly it's all just porn posting)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/
You might be thinking of the Millchan merger site, which is another thing that is harder to get to work indeed.

>>ad137345-4120-4cd2-a73f-97526d35617f
Yeah good point. it's part of the 3-3-3 radio plan. But not many people know about it and let's be honest nobody is going to memorize all that shit.

>>a7f242c9-020b-4b9b-8737-05ff9a978d9e
Yeah I guess not. There's also ZeroTalk which is much more limited but has lots of schizoposters already.

>>41f99557-5503-4799-a82a-9cb21f7720b6
Just from watching the video he posted on the ar15 site I know he's a soyboy LARPer who wouldn't shoot at the cops to save his life. Had I seen that before I wouldn't even have made this thread.

>>22e30327-5974-4f9a-bdcc-1d34d56570fe
Yeah I didn't suggest it because it's active. I suggested it because the guy running it is the guy who wrote the software 08chan is running on and it's being constantly updated unlike here.

>>bf46011b-8ffe-4896-b6d3-175b9d818a7b
>Now, will anyone listen?
no lol
mark my words zeronet will keep being just as shit for years before it improves in any meaningful way if it ever does

Also it's true that there's very little chance the cops would be able to tell whether he'd be charged or not at this point, since that'd depend on the prosecution and it'd be too early to tell.
We might be onto some fuckery here.
LARP or fed?

apparently it's fucking nothing
http://is2.4chan.org/gif/1574575121525.webm
Someone should figure out where the guy actually lives in this map

>>f8c753bc-7477-42b5-bd44-3f79da8ebd0e
I confirmed the location using the guy's address (http://i.4pcdn.org/pol/1574558692238.png) and google maps/street view
apparently it was a big nothingburger

>>653ed1fa-de91-4c85-86be-2d741d205250
His GF/wife (or according to some, his GF/wive's ex fuckbuddy) called the cops for domestic violence on him. And the property was probably not his and that's why he was charged with trespassing/burglary. The reason he had a duty to "talk" with the police was because they probably got an order to arrest him.
The reason the media said he wouldn't be charged could be because the cops said it so no more people would show up there to defend him or because they were telling that to him/ and the media to get him to come out.

>>32eaf993-5a9a-4b34-9876-933f9f67394b
nope
you can do it from a dynamic IP too

>>f59207cb-c7e9-469b-bded-c70b0bf41cb5
>Cell service blackout
That'd be interesting. Is there any evidence that happened at all?

>>3e967522-02e7-47b2-8991-95898cbf4b29
I think the stuff about the 30 round mags wasn't even what got the cops to him in the first place. Why would he have mags without even having a gun?

>>7c338c7e-934c-460b-b031-81a305d90442
>I, myself, can only suggest that places like ZeroNet should be seriously considered. (((They))) cannot shut that down.
Sure they can. All they would have to do would be to shut down the trackers. And if you're involved in the confrontation, good luck getting anything out with the feds jamming cellphones or banning your sim card/IMEI.

>>088c4cb3-6cd0-4546-be63-d1fc85ea15f3
stop making requests
the owner of this site can't code
the software running on here was written by millchan's owner and it's a 1 to 1 copy of the code on his git

>>7a109208-6325-41e2-91d3-f5a8e1194afc
the reason zeronet sucks is not the lack of peers. the architecture of the system itself sucks in various ways
you can see some of my complaints and how to improve it here http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1570109199_1N4DSSHorDvEkDGkQfUhnnryYiTdtUW8hU/Lets+fix+ZeroNet

>>4e98a52c-cdc7-4292-b30d-2a88564ba438
There's nothing wrong with crossposting. The problem is when people who are dumb or not adapted to the good parts of the culture arrive from somewhere else. But if they have already gotten familiar with the board and keep using the old site (or become users for that matter) it's not an issue. Using reddit for non political purposes is perfectly fine, as is posting on 4chan (except for the privacy concerns). Let's not pretend 8chan's level of discourse was that great either. I don't know about /v/, but on /tech/ and /pol/ you had plenty of trigger happy schizos ready to call you a shill for any minor disagreement, as well as obnoxious trolls in general. After all, 8chan was a derivative of 4chan, which always was full of trolls and weeb cancer.

>>2d3671bd-2437-4004-9b36-251f17e47f88
>>31585dea-b5e4-4242-8a39-cf224bfa1c52
This is a very bad idea.
The official Tor Browser binaries are compiled by experienced and trusted people, and many are keeping an eye on it.
Installing binaries put together by someone on here would be very dangerous. Just telling people to install ZeroNet and go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/08chan.bit would be much safer overall, even if other peers can see the IP on the network due to not using Tor. Very little can be done with just an IP.

>>f9beaa8e-39e9-4ab9-be94-af0f06b2337b
Nah. Nobody is going on a rampage because of not being able to get a 6 figure job.

>>70b50b83-e325-4b5b-a217-9f97863cdb98
There's no "devs" to talk to because there is only one dev here. And that is the Millchan dev. The guy who made this site can't code at all, and cloning a ZeroNet site is as easy as copying over some files and changing the address.

>>8a4d3d87-1922-429d-a673-d3e26161dd7c
It doesn't matter if it's a formal project or not. Judging from the posting activity on here, there won't be more than two people using the software, so the chances that somebody would detect a virus on it and alert everybody else would be very low.
>>f061a786-7bdb-43c7-a50f-85682aba29fa
That is how the taylovedus fag does it. If you meant creating a script that downloads tor browser and configures it however you see fit, then go ahead. Good luck reliably generating a ZeroID though, which is probably the hardest part of the process anyway.

>>e77f49ba-e0af-488b-86ca-81e9e56f1161
It's not so easy. It will take a lot of work to find the owner's IP even if he connects through the clearnet.
And taking down the owner is not enough if he is using FDE, you need to force him to reveal his FDE key if his computer is encrypted when found.
>>9596c41f-a5f1-4ebb-9f1b-b2ec50ee73c6
Nope. A site owner can't retrieve private key without breaking out of the js wrapper. It's true XSS or malicious owner will allow IP leak if not using Tor Browser or similar.
